definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
to hold/to contain/to grasp/to take hold of/handle/particle marking the following noun as a direct object/classifier for objects with handle/classifier for small objects: handful

sentences.english: The bone handle went flying across the room.
sentences.chinese: 短鞭的手把从屋里飞了过去。

sentences.english: Now, the Hulks has got its gentleman again, through me.
sentences.chinese: 现在监狱船又经过我的手把这个正人君子请回了。

sentences.english: Form the dough into a ball with your hands.
Use your hands, not a brush, so the teased hair stays lifted.
sentences.chinese: 用手把头发梳理好不要用头刷，头发就会依然服帖。

sentences.english: Open Son of Hibachi making sure the handles are in proper position and locked.
sentences.chinese: 翻开烤烤炉，确认手把位置以及能否固定了。

sentences.english: The color of the tubes and handles can be produced according to your demand.
sentences.chinese: 以上产品手把和弹力管的颜色客户可以自定搭配。

sentences.english: She looked at him, and smoothed out her apron with one hand.
sentences.chinese: 她看着他，用一只手把围裙弄平。

sentences.english: The tide riders surf the currents; the flags they hold up never get wet.
sentences.chinese: 弄潮儿向涛头立，手把红旗旗不湿。

sentences.english: She's really busy and can't always hold your hand.
sentences.chinese: 她十分忙，不可能总手把手教你。

sentences.english: If done with the ivory pieces or decorative ornaments are hand very elegant choice.
sentences.chinese: 用象牙果做手把件或者装饰摆件都是非常高雅的选择。

sentences.english: Using the opposite hand, twist your leg over the top of the other.
sentences.chinese: 用另一边的手把腿弯到另一条腿上。

sentences.english: We were all astonished to see him force a bar hooking.
sentences.chinese: 看见他用手把一根铁棒掰成钩形，我们都惊呆了。

sentences.english: His hair was over his eyebrows and he pushed it back.
sentences.chinese: 他的头发盖住了眉毛，他用手把他们拢向后面。

sentences.english: Press each piece with your hand and get a pancake.
sentences.chinese: 用手把每一小团压成一个小薄片。

sentences.english: Hoe in hand she steps through her portal.
sentences.chinese: 手把花锄出绣闱，忍踏落花来复去。

sentences.english: The spouts even double as the handle.
sentences.chinese: 茶壶的壶口跟壶手把甚至都是配备了。

definition: erhua variant of 使勁|使劲[shi3 jin4]
to detain/to hold back by force/to buckle/to hook
easily/without trouble/while one is at it/in passing/handy
to pinch (with one's fingers)/to knead/to make up
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
